private_information: I arrive at Marina District at 09:00
I can move between locations and my travel time is given in the environment
traveler.goal: Meet James for at least 75 minutes.

private_information: I will be at Alamo Square from 15:45 to 20:00
james.goal: Meet the traveler for at least 75 minutes.

orchestrator.goal: Find a schedule that allows the traveler to meet James for at least 75 minutes.

public_information: Two relevant locations: Marina District and Alamo Square.
Travel time between Marina District and Alamo Square is 15 minutes each way.
Traveler arrives at Marina District at 09:00.
James will be at Alamo Square from 15:45 to 20:00.
Goal is to meet James for at least 75 minutes.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems (Planning Domain Definition Language). You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. You always enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is traveler. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->traveler->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->traveler->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. If you miss some information, do not make assumptions, just give a plan that concerns the information you have. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems (Planning Domain Definition Language). You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. You always enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is james. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->james->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->james->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. If you miss some information, do not make assumptions, just give a plan that concerns the information you have. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems (Planning Domain Definition Language). You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. You always enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents, you keep their actions distinct.
pddl.prompt: There are two agents planning to meet. You will receive their PDDL domains and problems. You have to orchestrate them to solve the following task: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Keep in mind that the PDDL they send you may be partial or contain ambiguities. A partial PDDL may partially solve a planning problem but may require integration of information. Ambiguities may appear in different forms. Here is the first agent PDDL: {pddl_traveler} Here is the second agent PDDL: {pddl_james} You need to integrate the responses to solve the task. It is important that you keep the actions of the two agents distinct. Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
